member.name: T:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.Metering.GlsEmMcu
member.summary:
The GLS-EM-MCU is an Ethernet-based power metering control unit, designed to log overall electricity usage in real time. It measures and tracks actual energy consumption by attaching to the incoming electrical service and branch circuits.
This class will trigger , and events.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.ClDimmer.ParameterRaiseLowerRate
member.summary: Sets the time that it takes to ramp the light level from 0% to 100% (or vice versa) in raise/lower operations. Field is in seconds. Default value is 3 seconds. Valid values range from 1 second to 10 seconds. Use the SimplSharpDeviceHelper.SecondsToUShort to convert the time to a ushort value or the SimplSharpDeviceHelper.UShortToSeconds to convert the ushort value to seconds

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.ClDimmer.ParameterPresetFadeTime
member.summary: Sets the time that it takes to ramp the light level from its current level to the target level in preset recalls or full on operations. Field is in seconds. Default value is 1 second. Valid values range from 0.25s to 10s. Use the SimplSharpDeviceHelper.SecondsToUShort to convert the time to a ushort value or the SimplSharpDeviceHelper.UShortToSeconds to convert the ushort value to seconds

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.ClDimmer.ParameterOffFadeTime
member.summary: Sets the time that it takes to ramp the light level from its current level to 0% in full off and delayed off operations. Field is in seconds. Default value is 1 second. Valid values range from 0.25s to 30s. Use the SimplSharpDeviceHelper.SecondsToUShort to convert the time to a ushort value or the SimplSharpDeviceHelper.UShortToSeconds to convert the ushort value to seconds

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.ClDimmer.ParameterDimmerDelayedOffTime
member.summary: Sets the delay time prior to starting the off fade when performing a Dimmer delayed off operation. Field is in seconds. Default value is 0 seconds. Valid delay times range from 0s (no delay) to 600s (10 minutes). member.summary: Enum to define the CLX and DIN Motor States.

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.eClxMotorState.Open
member.summary: The motor will move in the open direction: Until it reaches the mechanical limit; or Set motor to Stop state to abort the operation anytime; or When the period given by the "ParameterMaximumTime" parameter has expired

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.eClxMotorState.Close
member.summary: The motor will move in the close direction: Until it reaches the mechanical limit; or Set motor to Stop state to abort the operation anytime; or When the period given by the "ParameterMaximumTime" parameter has expired

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.eClxMotorState.JogOpen
member.summary: Jogs the motor in the open direction: Until when the period given by the "ParameterJogTime" parameter has expired; or Set motor to Stop state to abort the operation anytime

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.eClxMotorState.JogClose
member.summary: Jogs the motor in the close direction: Until when the period given by the "ParameterJogTime" parameter has expired; or Set motor to Stop state to abort the operation anytime

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.eClxMotorState.Stop
member.summary: Aborts the current operation of the motor. Only applies to Open / Close.

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.eClxMotorState.OpenMomentary
member.summary: The motor will move in the open direction: Until when the period given by the "ParameterMaximumTime" parameter has expired Stops motor if the same state is set again. This state is applicable only for .

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.eClxMotorState.CloseMomentary
member.summary: The motor will move in the close direction: Until when the period given by the "ParameterMaximumTime" parameter has expired Stops motor if the same state is set again. This state is applicable only for .

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.eClxMotorState.OpenMomentaryFull
member.summary: The motor will move in open direction: If the motor is set to this state and is in this state for more than 0.5 seconds, then the motor will behavior will as if it is set to state. If the motor is in this state and same state is set again within 0.5 seconds the motor behavior will be like as if it is set to state. During the movement to the full open position if state is again set twice within 0.5 seconds then motor will be stopped. This state is applicable only for .

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.eClxMotorState.CloseMomentaryFull
member.summary: The motor will move in close direction: If the motor is set to this state and is in this state for more than 0.5 seconds, then the motor will behavior will as if it is set to state. If the motor is in this state and same state is set again within 0.5 seconds the motor behavior will be like as if it is set to state. During the movement to the full close position if state is again set twice within 0.5 seconds then motor will be stopped. This state is applicable only for .

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.eClxMotorState.OpenStopCloseStop
member.summary: Cycles between the , , and states. If the motor is stopped for some reason other than by setting this state again, e.g., the mechanical limit is reached, or another state is set, and later this state set the motor will move in the opposite direction. This state is applicable only for .

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.Horizon.HzDimBase.ParameterFakeFeedback
member.summary: Parameter to set and get the Fake Feedback state. When set to true, the LED corresponding to button will fade blink between On LED color and Off LED color at the time, for a minimum of 2 sec, until the or property value is initialized to some other state.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.Horizon.HzDimBase.ParameterActiveFeedbackBlinkRate
member.summary: Parameter to define the fade blink rate time between the LED On color and LED Off color. Value in seconds (units of 0.01 sec precision) for the blink/fade period of the LEDs when they are in active feedback state. Valid range is from 0.1 to 2 seconds. 1 second is represented as 100. Default value is 0.75 seconds. Use the to convert the seconds to a ushort value or the to convert the ushort value to seconds.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.Horizon.HzDimBase.ParameterHoldTime
member.summary: Time value in seconds. A press longer than this value triggers a Hold event. A press shorter than this value triggers a Tap or DoubleTap event. Use the to convert the seconds to a ushort value or the to convert the ushort value to seconds. Valid range is from 0.2 seconds to 1.0 seconds. 1 second is represented as 100.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.Horizon.HzDimBase.ParameterDoubleTapSpeed
member.summary: Returns and sets the time between the end of the first tap and the start of the second tap for a "DoubleTap" to be recognized. Use the to convert the seconds to a ushort value or the to convert the ushort value to seconds. Valid range is from 0.2 seconds to 1.0 seconds. 1 second is represented as 100.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.Horizon.HzDimBase.ParameterWaitForDoubleTap
member.summary: Returns and sets the setting that determines whether a "Tap" should be sent immediately. false – Tap is reported at the end of every short press, DoubleTap is reported at the end of the second short press. true – Tap reporting is postponed to see if a second tap comes in. In this case only DoubleTap is reported.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.Horizon.HzDimBase.ParameterCustomColorInputType

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.Horizon.HzDimBase.ParameterDayNightThresholdSetting
member.summary: Indicates which internal setting to use when device is automatically configured to switch between day and night mode based on sensor reading. Default (0) indicates it uses either the factory default threshold setting or the manually calibrated setting if it was saved at least once. Other preset selections are estimated values based on a typical room brightness setting. Valid values are from 0 to 5. Refer enum for valid values.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.Horizon.HzDimBase.ParameterAlternateColorTheme
member.summary: Parameter to select the color theme that is applied to the particular Button Feedback as set by the corresponding (true = Use Alternate Color Theme; false = Use Local Color Theme). If is chosen, then the corresponding , and properties will get processed instead of preset internal color themes that match much of the defined 'local' color themes. Refer enum for valid values.
member.exception: Throws this exception when tried to set the parameter value to an invalid value.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.Horizon.HzDimBase.ParameterLocalButtonStatusFeedback

member.exception: Invalid 'value' supplied to parameter. Please refer to for valid values.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.Horizon.HzDimBase.ParameterLocalButtonActiveFeedback
member.summary:
Parameter to define the behavior of the LED(s) when a local button is pressed to turn on or off a load. LED(s) can either flash, enable, or do nothing, disable. The timing of the blink is set by .
For quick ramps to the preset level or 100% which take place within a second, the LED will flash at least one transition and end up at on or off state. For a manual raise/lower operation where the button is held down, it will continue to flash while the button is held down, but stop once the ramp is completed and ended at the target level.
member.exception: Invalid 'value' supplied to parameter. Please refer to for valid values.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.Horizon.HzDimBase.ParameterRaiseLowerRate
member.summary:
Sets the time that it takes to ramp the light level from 0% to 100% (or vice versa) in raise/lower operations.
Field is in hundredths of a second where 25 is 0.25s.
Valid values range from 1 second to 10 seconds. Default value is 3 seconds (300 hundredths of a second).
Use to convert the time to a ushort value or the to convert the ushort value to seconds.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.Horizon.HzDimBase.ParameterOffFadeTime
member.summary:
Sets the time that it takes to ramp the light level from its current level to 0% when is used.
Field is in hundredths of a second where 25 is 0.25s.
Valid values range from 0.25s to 30s. Default value is 1 second (100 hundredths of a second).
Use to convert the time to a ushort value or the to convert the ushort value to seconds.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.Horizon.HzDimBase.ParameterOnFadeTime
member.summary:
Sets the time that it takes to ramp the light level from its current level to 100% when is used.
Field is in hundredths of a second where 25 is 0.25s.
Valid values range from 0.25s to 30s. Default value is 1 second (100 hundredths of a second).
Use to convert the time to a ushort value or the to convert the ushort value to seconds.

Valid values range from 0% to 100%. Default of 15%. Defines the threshold for the light level of the dimmer where it will switch to either Full On or Off when the zero cross symc is lost due to noise on the AC line.
Use to convert the percentage to a ushort value or to convert the ushort value to percentage.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.LDimmingLoad.IsOn
member.summary: Indicates that the load is on at any level.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.LDimmingLoad.Lower
member.summary: Smoothly lowers the light level from its current level to the min level for as long as the property is set 'true'. The ramping operation continues until the light reaches the min level or until the property is set 'false'.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.LDimmingLoad.Raise
member.summary: Smoothly raises the light level from its current level to 100% (max level) for as long as the property is set 'true'. The ramping operation continues until the light reaches 100% (max level) or until the property is set 'false'.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.LDimmingLoad.CycleDim
member.summary: Toggles between a raise and lower operation as follows: If load is Off or at the Min level, the load will raise. If load is at the Max level, the load will lower. At any other level, the load will change in the opposite direction of the last ramp (see raise/lower descriptions).
member.remarks: This property is not supported for the , "ClsC6" and "ClsC6M" devices.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.ClwLDimLoad.ParameterMinLevel
member.summary:
Set the minimum dim level for the lower operations.
Valid values range from 0% to 45%. Default of 0%.
Use to convert the percentage to a ushort value or to convert the ushort value to percentage.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.ClwLDimLoad.ParameterMaxLevel
member.summary:
Set the maximum dim level for full on and raise operations.
Valid values range from 55% to 100%. Default of 100%.
Use to convert the percentage to a ushort value or to convert the ushort value to percentage.

member.name: T:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.Clc1LedpwmRgbwGenericEx
member.summary:
The CLC-1LED-PWM-RGBW-Generic is a 4 channel PWM dimmer, designed to drive LED (strip) loads. It is composed of 4 independent PWM output channels in a single module. Each channel supports a 1 Amp load where the total module rating is 4 Amps.
This class will trigger event.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.Horizon.HzSwBase.ParameterFakeFeedback
member.summary: Parameter to set and get the Fake Feedback state. When set to true, the LED corresponding to button will fade blink between On LED color and Off LED color at the time, for a minimum of 2 sec, until the or property value is initialized to some other state.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.Horizon.HzSwBase.ParameterActiveFeedbackBlinkRate
member.summary: Parameter to define the fade blink rate time between the LED On color and LED Off color. Value in seconds (units of 0.01 sec precision) for the blink/fade period of the LEDs when they are in active feedback state. Valid range is from 0.1 to 2 seconds. 1 second is represented as 100. Default value is 0.75 seconds. Use the to convert the seconds to a ushort value or the to convert the ushort value to seconds.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.Horizon.HzSwBase.ParameterHoldTime
member.summary: Time value in seconds. A press longer than this value triggers a Hold event. A press shorter than this value triggers a Tap or DoubleTap event. Use the to convert the seconds to a ushort value or the to convert the ushort value to seconds. Valid range is from 0.2 seconds to 1.0 seconds. 1 second is represented as 100.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.Horizon.HzSwBase.ParameterDoubleTapSpeed
member.summary: Returns and sets the time between the end of the first tap and the start of the second tap for a "DoubleTap" to be recognized. Use the to convert the seconds to a ushort value or the to convert the ushort value to seconds. Valid range is from 0.2 seconds to 1.0 seconds. 1 second is represented as 100.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.Horizon.HzSwBase.ParameterWaitForDoubleTap
member.summary: Returns and sets the setting that determines whether a "Tap" should be sent immediately. false – Tap is reported at the end of every short press, DoubleTap is reported at the end of the second short press. true – Tap reporting is postponed to see if a second tap comes in. In this case only DoubleTap is reported.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.Horizon.HzSwBase.ParameterCustomColorInputType
member.summary: Selects whether the properties in / / / are to be processed as RGB (Red/Green/Blue) or HSV (Hue/Saturation/Value) component values. Refer enum for valid values.
member.exception: Throws this exception when tried to set the parameter value to an invalid value.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.Horizon.HzSwBase.ParameterDayNightThresholdSetting
member.summary: Indicates which internal setting to use when device is automatically configured to switch between day and night mode based on sensor reading. Default (0) indicates it uses either the factory default threshold setting or the manually calibrated setting if it was saved at least once. Other preset selections are estimated values based on a typical room brightness setting. Valid values are from 0 to 5. Refer enum for valid values.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.Horizon.HzSwBase.ParameterAlternateColorTheme
member.summary: Parameter to select the color theme that is applied to the particular Button Feedback as set by the corresponding (true = Use Alternate Color Theme; false = Use Local Color Theme). If is chosen, then the corresponding , and properties will get processed instead of preset internal color themes that match much of the defined 'local' color themes. Refer enum for valid values.
member.exception: Throws this exception when tried to set the parameter value to an invalid value.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.Horizon.HzSwBase.ParameterLocalButtonStatusFeedback
member.summary: Parameter to define what LED(s) are turned on when the load is on (level above zero percent) or off.
member.exception: Invalid 'value' supplied to parameter. Please refer to for valid values.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.Horizon.HzSwBase.ParameterLocalButtonActiveFeedback
member.summary:
Parameter to define the behavior of the LED(s) when a local button is pressed to turn on or off a load. LED(s) can either flash, enable, or do nothing, disable. The timing of the blink is set by .
For quick ramps to the preset level or 100% which take place within a second, the LED will flash at least one transition and end up at on or off state. For a manual raise/lower operation where the button is held down, it will continue to flash while the button is held down, but stop once the ramp is completed and ended at the target level.
member.exception: Invalid 'value' supplied to parameter. Please refer to for valid values.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.DinMotor.IsMovingFeedback
member.summary:
Property to indicate that the motor has received an Open or Close command (momentary, full or jog).
The event will trigger with .
member.remarks: The value of this property remains true until a stop command is sent, or until the "max time" or "jog time" has expired.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.DinMotor.IsLastDirectionOpenFeedback
member.summary:
Property to indicate that the current direction of movement is Open (momentary, full or jog).
The event will trigger with .
member.remarks: If not currently moving, indicates that the previous direction of movement was Open.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.DinMotor.IsLastDirectionCloseFeedback
member.summary:
Property to indicate that the current direction of movement is Close (momentary, full or jog).
The event will trigger with .
member.remarks: If not currently moving, indicates that the previous direction of movement was Close.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.ClciMcex.ClciMcexMotorController.OpenStopCloseStop
member.summary: Method to cycle the shade group through the Open Full, Stop, Close Full and Stop commands.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.ClciMcex.ClciMcexMotorController.OpenMomentaryFull
member.summary: Opens the shade group toward the full open position for as long as the value is true (open momentary) and stops on release. If the property value changes from true to false within 0.5 seconds, then the shades open to the full open position (open full).
member.remarks: true = Open momentary; false = Stop and false -> true = Open full; false = No effect

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.ClciMcex.ClciMcexMotorController.CloseMomentaryFull
member.summary: Closes the shade group toward the full closed position for as long as the value is true (close momentary) and stops on release. If the property changes from true to false within 0.5 seconds, then the shades close to the full closed position (close full).
member.remarks: true = Close momentary; false = Stop and false->true = Close full; false = No effect

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.ClciMcex.ClciMcexMotorController.ParameterSlaveSwitchType
member.summary: Specifies whether a maintained or momentary slave switch is connected to the unit. Maintained is the default.
member.exception: Invalid slave switch type specified.

member.name: T:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.ZumWired.ZumNetBridge
member.summary: Ethernet/Cresnet bridge that allows control system access to the components on the local cresnet bus within the room. Controls/coordinates room level operations amongst devices on the room’s cresnet bus operates as a single client on the room’s cresnet bus cresnet bus master operation required for room controller operation presents the Room as a device to the Ethernet network appears as a device on the room’s cresnet network allows operation as an Ethernet/Cresnet Bridge to the devices on the room’s cresnet network this feature can be enabled/disabled from the control system cresnet bus master operation required for Bridge operation, already present for Room Control.

member.name: T:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.ZumWired.ZumNetBridgeRoom
member.summary: Ethernet/Cresnet bridge that allows control system access to the components on the local cresnet bus within the room and also allows the control system to address the room as a whole through additional joins. Controls/coordinates room level operations amongst devices on the room’s cresnet bus operates as a single client on the room’s cresnet bus cresnet bus master operation required for room controller operation presents the Room as a device to the Ethernet network appears as a device on the room’s cresnet network allows operation as an Ethernet/Cresnet Bridge to the devices on the room’s cresnet network this feature can be enabled/disabled from the control system cresnet bus master operation required for Bridge operation, already present for Room Control.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.ZumWired.ZumNetBridgeRoom.ZumWiredRoomInterface.EnableVicinityBinding
member.summary: Method to enable the vicinity occupancy binding logic Vicinity Binding refers to the load controller using a third Occupancy/Vacancy sensor input. Rather than Occupied or Vacant, Vicinity will mean someone is nearby (in the vicinity). When enabled, the load controller can use this input to determine that someone its zone is unoccupied, but someone is in a nearby zone. The load controller can then choose to turn on at a lower level, just to provide a feeling that there is not a wall of darkness surrounding the occupant. In some films you see corridors where the illumination follows the characters as they walk, the ones at the extreme end of that corridor of light will be triggered by their vicinity sensors rather than direct occupation.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.ZumWired.ZumNetBridgeRoom.ZumWiredRoomInterface.DisableVicinityBinding
member.summary: Method to disable the vicinity occupancy binding logic

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.ZumWired.ZumNetBridgeRoom.ZumWiredRoomInterface.EnableAutoOffTimer
member.summary: Method to enable the auto off timer. When enabled, turning lights on starts a timer. Room will turn lights off when timer expires. Timer is retrigger-able by any event that would turn a light on. Ex. Occupancy sensor. Room flashes lights for "10 minutes" warning. Time in minutes

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.DaliLoop.Execute(System.Byte,System.Byte)
member.summary: Method to send the 2-byte DALI control/query command or special command specified by "paramAddress" (byte 1) and "paramCommandOrData" (byte 2). The commands can be sent to individual // all ballasts that are part of the .
member.param: The address portion (byte 1) of the 2-byte DALI control/query command or special command.
The command portion (byte 2) of the 2-byte DALI control/query or special command.
member.remarks: Command numbers from 256 to 272 are special commands. Address formats are as follows... Short or group address: YAAA AAAS Short addresses 0 through 63: 0AAA AAAS Group addresses 0 through 15: 100A AAAS Broadcast: 1111 111S Special commands (broadcast): 101C CCC1 or 110C CCC1 Where A is the significant address bit; S is the selector bit (0 = direct arc power level following; 1 = command following); C is the significant "SPECIAL COMMAND"; and Y is the address specifier (0 = short address; 1 - group address or broadcast)
Use for selecting the commands, for special commands the command value to be passed manually.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.DaliLoop.Execute(System.Byte,System.Byte,System.Byte)
member.summary: Method to send the 3-byte DALI command. The DALI command consists of "paramAddress" (byte 1), "paramCommandOrData" (byte 2) and "paramData" (byte 3).
member.param: The address portion (byte 1) of the 3-byte DALI command.
The control command portion (byte 2) of the 3-byte DALI command. This portion specifies what is to be accomplished by the devices that were addressed in the address byte.
The data portion (byte 3) of the 3-byte DALI command. This portion specifies the data parameters for the "CommandOrData" control command.
member.remarks: Address range for Controller Individual Addressing - 0 through 63.
Address range for Controller Originator Addressing - 64 through 127.
Address range for Controller Type Addressing - 128 through 191.
Address range for Controller Individual Addressing - 192 through 223.
Controller Common Control Commands (shared by all DALI control devices): 0 to 127 (0x00 to 0x7F hex).
Controller Specific Type Commands (used by up to 64 specific device types): 128 to 191 (0x80 to 0xBF hex).
Controller Manufacturing Specific Commands (used by manufacturer's devices): 192 to 255 (0xC0 to 0xFF hex).
Use for selecting the address if Controller Type Addressing is to be used.
Use for selecting the Common Control Commands, for other commands the command value to be passed manually.

member.name: T:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.DaliLoop.eTwoByteCommandCodes
member.summary: Enum to define DALI 2-byte Command codes. Based on the address provided for the command the command will be sent to //All Ballasts. For Direct Arc Power Control command the arc power level shall be provided in place of the command code. Refer the DALI specification "IEC 62386-102 Digital addressable Lighting Interface_General Requirements-Control Gear.pdf" for more details on the following commands.

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.DaliLoop.eTwoByteCommandCodes.Off
member.summary: The lamp shall be extinguished immediately without fading.

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.DaliLoop.eTwoByteCommandCodes.Up
member.summary: Dim up 200 ms using the selected FADE RATE. During fading bit 4 on the status register shall indicate a “fade is running”. There shall be no change if the arc power level is already at the "MAX LEVEL".

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.DaliLoop.eTwoByteCommandCodes.Down
member.summary: Dim down 200 ms using the selected FADE RATE. During fading bit 4 on the status register shall indicate a “fade is running”. There shall be no change if the arc power level is already at the "MIN LEVEL".

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.DaliLoop.eTwoByteCommandCodes.StepUp
member.summary: The actual arc power level shall be set one step higher immediately without fading. There shall be no change if the arc power level is already at the "MAX LEVEL".

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.DaliLoop.eTwoByteCommandCodes.StepDown
member.summary: The actual arc power level shall be set one step lower immediately without fading. There shall be no change if the arc power level is already at the "MIN LEVEL".

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.DaliLoop.eTwoByteCommandCodes.RecallMaximumLevel
member.summary: The actual arc power level shall be set to the "MAX LEVEL" without fading. If the lamp is off it shall be switched on with this command.

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.DaliLoop.eTwoByteCommandCodes.RecallMinimumLevel
member.summary: The actual arc power level shall be set to the "MIN LEVEL" without fading. If the lamp is off it shall be switched on with this command.

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.DaliLoop.eTwoByteCommandCodes.StepDownAndOff
member.summary: The actual arc power level shall be set one step lower immediately without fading. If the actual arc power level is already at the "MIN LEVEL", the lamp shall be switched off by this command.

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.DaliLoop.eTwoByteCommandCodes.OnAndStepUp
member.summary: The actual arc power level shall be set one step higher immediately without fading. If the lamp is switched off, the lamp shall be switched on with this command and shall be set to the "MIN LEVEL".

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.DaliLoop.eTwoByteCommandCodes.GoToScene0
member.summary: Set the actual arc power level to the value stored for scene 0 using the actual fade time. During fading, bit 4 on the status register shall indicate a "fade is running".

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.DaliLoop.eTwoByteCommandCodes.GoToScene1
member.summary: Set the actual arc power level to the value stored for scene 1 using the actual fade time. During fading, bit 4 on the status register shall indicate a "fade is running".

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.DaliLoop.eTwoByteCommandCodes.Reset
member.summary: Configuration commands

After the second reception of the command, the variables in the memory (see Clause 10) shall be changed to their reset values. It is not guaranteed that commands are received properly within the next 300 ms.

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.DaliLoop.eTwoByteCommandCodes.StoreActualLevelInTheDtr
member.summary: The actual arc power level shall be stored in the DTR. In case of a lamp failure the "virtual” Arc Power Level shall be stored.

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.DaliLoop.eTwoByteCommandCodes.StoreDtrAsMaximumLevel
member.summary: The value in "Data Transfer Register" shall be saved as the new "MAX LEVEL".

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.DaliLoop.eTwoByteCommandCodes.StoreDtrAsMinimumLevel
member.summary: The value in "Data Transfer Register" shall be stored as new "MIN LEVEL".

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.DaliLoop.eTwoByteCommandCodes.StoreDtrAsSystemFailureLevel
member.summary: The value in "Data Transfer Register" shall be saved as new "SYSTEM FAILURE LEVEL".

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.DaliLoop.eTwoByteCommandCodes.StoreDtrAsPowerOnLevel
member.summary: The value in "Data Transfer Register" shall be saved as the new "POWER ON LEVEL".

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.DaliLoop.eTwoByteCommandCodes.StoreDtrAsFadeTime
member.summary: Store the DTR value as Fade Time. The new fade time shall be valid after the reception of the next arc power command.

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.DaliLoop.eTwoByteCommandCodes.StoreDtrAsFadeRate
member.summary: Store the DTR value as Fade Rate. The new fade rate shall be valid after the reception of the next arc power command.

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.DaliLoop.eTwoByteCommandCodes.StoreDtrAsShortAddress
member.summary: The value in the DTR shall be saved as a new short address.

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.DaliLoop.eTwoByteCommandCodes.QueryStatus
member.summary: Query commands
Query the control gear status. The answer shall be the "STATUS INFORMATION" byte. Refer "eBallastStatus" enum for information on status bits.

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.DaliLoop.eTwoByteCommandCodes.QueryBallast
member.summary: Ask if there is a control gear with the given address that is able to communicate. The answer shall be "Yes" or "No".

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.DaliLoop.eTwoByteCommandCodes.QueryLampFailure
member.summary: Ask if there is a lamp problem at the given address. The answer shall be "Yes" or "No".

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.DaliLoop.eTwoByteCommandCodes.QueryLampPowerOn
member.summary: Ask if there is a lamp operating at the given address. The answer shall be "Yes" or "No".

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.DaliLoop.eTwoByteCommandCodes.QueryLimitError
member.summary: Ask if the last requested arc power level at the given address could not be met, because it is above the MAX LEVEL or below the MIN LEVEL. The answer shall be "Yes" or "No".

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.DaliLoop.eTwoByteCommandCodes.QueryResetState
member.summary: Ask if the control gear is in "RESET STATE". The answer shall be "Yes" or "No".

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.DaliLoop.eTwoByteCommandCodes.QueryMissingStartAddress
member.summary: Ask if the control gear has no short address. The answer shall be "Yes" or "No". The answer shall be "Yes" if the control gear has no short address.

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.DaliLoop.eTwoByteCommandCodes.QueryVersionNumber
member.summary: Query the Version Number of the control gear. The answer shall be 1.

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.DaliLoop.eTwoByteCommandCodes.QueryContentDtr
member.summary: Query the DTR content of the control gear. The answer shall be the content of the DTR as an 8-bit number.

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.DaliLoop.eTwoByteCommandCodes.QueryDeviceType
member.summary: Query the device type of the control gear. The answer shall be the device type as an 8-bit number. If the control gear supports more than one device type the answer shall be 255 (“MASK”).

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.DaliLoop.eTwoByteCommandCodes.QueryPhysicalMinimumLevel
member.summary: Query the physical minimum level. The answer shall be the "PHYSICAL MINIMUM LEVEL" as an 8-bit number.

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.DaliLoop.eTwoByteCommandCodes.QueryPowerFailure
member.summary: The answer shall be "YES" if the control gear has not received a "RESET" or one of the following arc power control commands since the last power-on: "DIRECT ARC POWER CONTROL", "OFF", "RECALL MAX LEVEL", "RECALL MIN LEVEL", "STEP DOWN AND OFF", "ON AND STEP UP", "GO TO SCENE"

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.DaliLoop.eTwoByteCommandCodes.QueryActualLevel
member.summary: Query the arc power level of the control gear. The answer shall be the actual arc power level. During preheating and whenever there is a lamp error the answer shall be "MASK".

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.DaliLoop.eTwoByteCommandCodes.QueryMaximumLevel
member.summary: Query the maximum arc power level of the control gear. The answer shall be this level as an 8-bit number.

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.DaliLoop.eTwoByteCommandCodes.QueryMinimumLevel
member.summary: Query the minimum arc power level of the control gear. The answer shall be this level as an 8-bit number.

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.DaliLoop.eTwoByteCommandCodes.QueryPowerOnLevel
member.summary: Query the power on level of control gear. The answer shall be this level as an 8-bit number.

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.DaliLoop.eTwoByteCommandCodes.QuerySystemFailureLevel
member.summary: Query the system failure level of the control gear. The answer shall be this level as an 8-bit number.

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.DaliLoop.eTwoByteCommandCodes.QueryFadeTimeOrFadeRate
member.summary: Query the Fade Time/Rate of the control gear. The answer shall be XXXX YYYY, where XXXX is the fade time and YYYY is the fade rate.

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.DaliLoop.eTwoByteCommandCodes.QueryScene0Level
member.summary: Query the Scene 0 level of the control gear. The answer shall be the arc power level of scene 0 as an 8-bit number.

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.DaliLoop.eTwoByteCommandCodes.QueryScene1Level
member.summary: Query the Scene 1 level of the control gear. The answer shall be the arc power level of scene 1 as an 8-bit number.

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.DaliLoop.eTwoByteCommandCodes.QueryScene2Level
member.summary: Query the Scene 1 level of the control gear. The answer shall be the arc power level of scene 2 as an 8-bit number.

member.summary: Query the Scene 1 level of the control gear. The answer shall be the arc power level of scene 3 as an 8-bit number.

member.summary: Query the Scene 1 level of the control gear. The answer shall be the arc power level of scene 4 as an 8-bit number.

member.summary: Query the Scene 1 level of the control gear. The answer shall be the arc power level of scene 5 as an 8-bit number.

member.summary: Query the Scene 1 level of the control gear. The answer shall be the arc power level of scene 6 as an 8-bit number.

member.summary: Query the Scene 1 level of the control gear. The answer shall be the arc power level of scene 7 as an 8-bit number.

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.DaliLoop.eTwoByteCommandCodes.QueryScene8Level
member.summary: Query the Scene 1 level of the control gear. The answer shall be the arc power level of scene 8 as an 8-bit number.

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.DaliLoop.eTwoByteCommandCodes.QueryScene9Level

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.ClcFandelvex.ParameterRaiseLowerRate
member.summary: Sets the time that it takes to ramp the light level from 0% to 100% (or vice versa) in raise/lower operations. Field is in seconds. Default value is 3 seconds. Valid values range from 1 second to 10 seconds. Use SimplSharpDeviceHelper.SecondsToUShort to convert the time to a ushort value or SimplSharpDeviceHelper.UShortToSeconds to convert the ushort value to seconds
member.exception: Indicates specified argument is out of range

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.ClcFandelvex.ParameterDimmerMinLevel

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.ClcFandelvex.ParameterDimmerMaxLevel

member.exception: Indicates specified argument is out of range

member.summary: When set to Always On (0d) the relay is always engaged.

member.summary: Button settings slot device.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.ClcButtonSettings.ParameterRemoteHoldTime
member.summary: This parameter does not apply to "maintained" switches. The time that a button must be held before it is recognized as a "Hold" instead of a "Tap". Valid values range from 0.20 to 1.00 seconds. Use the SimplSharpDeviceHelper.SecondsToUShort to convert the time to a ushort value or the SimplSharpDeviceHelper.UShortToSeconds to convert the ushort value to seconds

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.ClcButtonSettings.ParameterRemoteDoubleTapTime
member.summary: This parameter does not apply to "maintained" switches. The time between the end of the first tap and the start of the second tap for a double tap to be recognized. Valid values range from 0.25 to 1.00 seconds. Use the SimplSharpDeviceHelper.SecondsToUShort to convert the time to a ushort value or the SimplSharpDeviceHelper.UShortToSeconds to convert the ushort value to seconds

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.ClcButtonSettings.ParameterRemoteWaitForDoubleTap
member.summary: This parameter does not apply to "maintained" switches. Determines whether a "Tap" should be sent immediately on the release of the button, or if the unit should wait until a Double Tap event occurs

member.summary: Specifies the primary delay period used when an occupancy sensor is connected to the "O" terminal. Valid values range from 0s to 1800s. When a 3rd-party switch is connected to the "O" terminal, this parameter must be set to 0s.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.Clc1dimflv2ex24vButtonSettings.ParameterAlternateOccupancySensorDelay
member.summary: Specifies the alternate delay period used when an occupancy sensor is connected to the "O" terminal and Use_Alternate_Occ_Delay = high/1. Valid values range from 0s to 1800s.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.ZummeshNetbridge.DaylightingEnabledFeedback
member.summary:
Property to indicate if daylighting (daylight harvesting) is enabled in the room. This property will be updated when method is called for scene1 or when or methods are called or when method is called for scenes 2-16.
The event will trigger with .
member.remarks: true = daylighting enabled, false = daylighting disabled

Daylight harvesting is a process by which the light level in a room is kept constant despite the intrusion of sunlight through an exterior window. It is intended to save power as well. In a Locus room, there can be sensor that measures the incoming daylight. If there is, the measured value is distributed to all the load controllers (dimmers) in the room. When Daylighting is enabled, the load controllers use this measured value to adjust the level of their attached light loads in such a manner that the apparent light saturation in the room remains constant.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.ZummeshNetbridge.OccupancyDetectedFeedback
member.summary:
Property to indicate if the room's logic determined that the room is occupied. Either from the sensors, or direct command.
The event will trigger with .
member.remarks: false = Vacancy detected, true = Occupancy detected

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.ZummeshNetbridge.ResumeFirmwareLoad
member.summary: Property to resume the firmware load operation on the controller. This will resume any pending updates on the device. The will trigger to reflect the state of the controller.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.ZummeshNetbridge.FirmwareLoadSuspendedFeedback
member.summary:
Feedback to reflect the firmware loading state of the device.
The event will trigger with .

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.ZummeshNetbridge.LoadShedEnable
member.summary: Property to enable/disable Load Shedding. When "true" will enable Load Shedding. When set to "false", Load Shedding is disabled. This sends a signal to every load controller in the room telling it to go into Load Shedding mode. Basically Load Shedding Mode is a state where there is an alternate MAXimum value imposed on the dimmers as specified by . For switch type controllers, it may tell the device that it needs to be off when Load Shedding is enabled. The minimum firmware version on the device which supports this property is v1.009.0012.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.ZummeshNetbridge.SolarSynchronizeActive
member.summary: Property to enable/disable Solar Synchronize. Setting to 'True' enables Solar Synchronize, setting to 'False' will disable Solar Synchronize.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.ZummeshNetbridge.PlugControllerStatusFeedback
member.summary:
Feedback to reflect the status of all the plug loads on the controller.
The event will trigger with . The minimum firmware version on the device which supports this property is v1.008.0001.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.ZummeshNetbridge.FirmwareUpdateStatusFeedback
member.summary:
Feedback to reflect the the overall upgrade status of a room A value of false indicates that the system is idle, all updates completed or never requested since a bridge reboot which happens after bridge upgrades itself. A value of true indicates that the update is pending.
The event will trigger with . The minimum firmware version on the device which supports this property is v1.008.0001.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.ZummeshNetbridge.SolarSynchronizeActiveFeedback
member.summary:
Property to report the solar synchronize status. True indicates solar synchronize is active, False indicates solar synchronize is deactive.
The event will trigger with .

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.ZummeshNetbridge.CurrentDaylightLevelFeedback
member.summary:
Property to report the daylight level reported to the room's devices by the daylight sensor, if there is one.
The event will trigger with .

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.ZummeshNetbridge.NumberOfDevicesFeedback
member.summary:
Property to report the current number of active devices in the room. Reports each time the number changes.
The event will trigger with .

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.ZummeshNetbridge.LoadShedMaxLevel
member.summary: Property to set the sets the maximum level of all dimmers. Used during load shedding to limit peak load which can cut on electricity costs. Valid range is 0 to 100. 0 being dimmer is off and 100 being max level. Default value is a 100. Use the "SimplSharpDeviceHelper.UshortToPercent" to convert the ushort value to percentage. The minimum firmware version on the device which supports this property is v1.008.0001.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.ZummeshNetbridge.CctZone

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.ClwiDimmer.SetMinLevel
member.summary: Sets the minimum dim level setting. Allowable integer input range between 0x0000-0x7FFF (0% - 49%). Values outside this range shall clamp to 49%.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.ClwiDimmer.SetMaxLevel
member.summary: Sets the maximum dim level setting. Allowable values between 0xC000-0xFFFF (75% - 100%). If passed a value outside this range the level will be set to 75%.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.ClwiDimmer.ParameterRaiseLowerRate
member.summary: Sets the time that it takes to ramp the light level from 0% to 100% (or vice versa) in raise/lower operations. Field is in hundredths of a second. Default value is 3 seconds (300 hundredths of a second). Valid values range from 1 second to 5 seconds. Use the SimplSharpDeviceHelper.SecondsToUShort to convert the time to a ushort value or the SimplSharpDeviceHelper.UShortToSeconds to convert the ushort value to seconds

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.ClwiDimmer.ParameterPresetFadeTime
member.summary: Sets the time that it takes to ramp the light level from its current level to the target level in preset recalls or full on operations. Field is in hundredths of a second. Default value is 1 second (100 hundredths of a second). Valid values range from 0.25s to 10s. Use the SimplSharpDeviceHelper.SecondsToUShort to convert the time to a ushort value or the SimplSharpDeviceHelper.UShortToSeconds to convert the ushort value to seconds

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.ClwiDimmer.ParameterOffFadeTime
member.summary: Sets the time that it takes to ramp the light level from its current level to 0% in full off and delayed off operations. Field is in hundredths of a second. Default value is 1 second (100 hundredths of a second). Valid values range from 0.25s to 30s. Use the SimplSharpDeviceHelper.SecondsToUShort to convert the time to a ushort value or the SimplSharpDeviceHelper.UShortToSeconds to convert the ushort value to seconds

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.ClwiDimmer.ParameterDimmerDelayedOffTime
member.summary: Sets the delay time prior to starting the off fade when performing a dimmer delayed off operation. Field is in hundredths of a second. Default value is 0 seconds. Valid values range from 0s to 600s. Use the SimplSharpDeviceHelper.SecondsToUShort to convert the time to a ushort value or the SimplSharpDeviceHelper.UShortToSeconds to convert the ushort value to seconds

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.ClwiDimmer.ParameterPreset1Default
member.summary: Sets the default level of the corresponding preset. This level will be active at startup and whenever the reset function is triggered. Default value is 100% Valid values range from 0% to 100% Use to convert the percentage to a ushort value or to convert the ushort value to percentage.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.ClwiDimmer.ParameterPreset2Default
member.summary: Sets the default level of the corresponding preset. This level will be active at startup and whenever the reset function is triggered. Default value is 50% Valid values range from 0% to 100% Use the to convert the percentage to a ushort value or to convert the ushort value to percentage.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.ClwiDimmer.ParameterPreset3Default
member.summary: Sets the default level of the corresponding preset. This level will be active at startup and whenever the reset function is triggered. Default value is 25% Valid values range from 0% to 100% Use to convert the percentage to a ushort value or to convert the ushort value to percentage.

member.summary: Property to get the collection of feedbacks on the device.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.ClwiDimmer.InNightlightMode
member.summary: Returns the input cue that can be used to enable or disable nightlight mode. When the input cue is set to true it enables nightlight mode when it is set to false it disables nightlight mode.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.ClwiDimmer.LeftRemoteBargraph
member.summary: Sets the left bargraph to the designated percentage. If set between 1 and 100 enables bargraph mode and sets bargraph to the designated percentage. Setting to 0 disables bargraph mode.
member.exception: Value must be between 0 and 100.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.ClsC6xBase.ClsC6Dimming.LightsUp
member.summary: Property to raise the level of the lights in the last (most recently recalled) scene. The lights will continue fading up until the property value is true, or until the lights reach 100% (or the upper limit). This property is not supported for scene type.
member.remarks: false = Fade last scene up; true = Stop fade

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.ClsC6xBase.ClsC6Dimming.LightsUpFeedback
member.summary:
Property to indicate that the lights in the scene are fading up. This property is not supported for scene type.
This property will trigger event with .
member.remarks: true = Last scene fading up; false = Fade stopped

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.ClsC6xBase.ClsC6Dimming.LightsDown
member.summary: Property to lower the level of the lights in the scene. The lights will continue fading down until the property value is false, or until the lights reach 0% (or the lower limit). This property is not supported for scene type.
member.remarks: true = Fade last scene down; false = Stop fade

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.ClsC6xBase.ClsC6Dimming.LightsDownFeedback
member.summary:

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.ClsC6xBase.ClsC6Scene.Recall
member.summary: Method to recall the scene. A second call to this method while the lights are fading will immediately cut the lights to 0%.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.ClsC6xBase.ClsC6Scene.LightsOff
member.summary: Method to turn off the lights in the scene. This method is not supported for . A second call to this method while the lights are fading will immediately cut the lights to 0%. This method has no effect on the shades; thus this method is intended for use only if the scene does not include shades.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.ClsC6xBase.ClsC6Scene.Toggle
member.summary: Method to toggle the scene between the On and Off states. This property is not supported for A second call to this method while the lights are fading will immediately cut the lights to the target levels.

member.summary:
Property to indicate that the scene is being recalled.

member.remarks: true = scene recalling; false = scene not recalling

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.ClsC6xBase.ClsC6Scene.RecallingLightsOffFeedback
member.summary:
Property to indicate that the lights in the scene are being turned off. This property is not supported for
This property will trigger event with .
member.remarks: true = Lights fading to 0%; false = Lights not fading to 0%

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.ClsC6xBase.ClsC6Scene.SelectedFeedback
member.summary:
Property to indicate that the scene has been selected. If another scene is engaged that affects any of the same lights in the scene, this will set the value to 'false' even if the target level for a given light doesn't change.
This property will trigger event with .
member.remarks: true = scene selected; true = scene not selected

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.ClsC6xBase.ClsC6Scene.AnyLightsOnFeedback
member.summary:
Property to indicate that at least one affected light in the scene is above 0%. This property is not supported for This provides a way to determine which state will be triggered by the next call to .
This property will trigger event with .
member.remarks: true = Any light in scene is On; false = No light in scene is On

member.summary: Method to cycle the shade group through the Open Full, Stop, Close Full and Stop commands.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.ClsC6xBase.ClsC6ShadeController.OpenMomentaryFull
member.summary: Opens the shade group toward the full open position for as long as the value is true (open momentary) and stops on release. If the property value changes from true to false within 0.5 seconds, then the shades open to the full open position (open full).
member.remarks: true = Open momentary; false = Stop and false -> true = Open full; false = No effect

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.ClsC6xBase.ClsC6ShadeController.CloseMomentaryFull
member.summary: Closes the shade group toward the full closed position for as long as the value is true (close momentary) and stops on release. If the property changes from true to false within 0.5 seconds, then the shades close to the full closed position (close full).
member.remarks: true = Close momentary; false = Stop and false->true = Close full; false = No effect

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.ClsC6xBase.ClsC6SceneProgramming.QuickSave

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.ClsC6xBase.ClsC6SceneProgramming.ProgramSceneByNumber
member.summary:
Method to enable the scene specified in to be programmed. This enables properties in the , and classes for scene programming, and locks out all other properties. When scene programming is enabled, the CLS-C6 will recall the specified (with no fade time). In addition, the properties , will be updated and reports the affected lights and shades.
A call to or will save or cancel the current settings and sets this property value to false, thus exiting scene programming. A second call to this method while scene programming is active will re-start scene programming using the current .

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.ClsC6xBase.ClsC6SceneProgramming.Save
member.summary: Method to save the current light levels, shade positions and "locked" status into the scene specified in the .

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.ClsC6xBase.ClsC6SceneProgramming.Cancel
member.summary: Method to cancel the scene programming and restores the specified to the original values. This will exit scene programming and drive all feedback outputs to 0.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.ClsC6xBase.ClsC6SceneProgramming.LockScene
member.summary: Method to turn on the "locked" setting for the selected . This means that when the scene is saved, the local buttons on the CLS-C6 will be locked out from adjusting the lights, shades, or fade times.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.ClsC6xBase.ClsC6SceneProgramming.UnlockScene
member.summary: Method to turn off the "locked" setting for the selected . This means that when the scene is saved, the local buttons on the CLS-C6 can control the lights, shades, and fade times. This means that when the scene is saved, the local buttons on the CLS-C6 can control the lights, shades, and fade times.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.ClsC6xBase.ClsC6SceneProgramming.ProgrammedScene
member.summary: Property to set the current scene that will be programmed when scene programming is activated (when method is called). The scene number must be set before activating scene programming. Any change in the scene number/type will be ignored during scene programming.
member.exception: Scene type set is not valid.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.ClsC6xBase.ClsC6SceneProgramming.ProgrammedSceneFeedback

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.ClsC6xBase.ClsC6SceneProgramming.IncrementFadeTime
member.summary: Property to increment the fade time. The fade time is the time it takes for all the lights in the scene to reach their target levels. The fade time will increment within a range of 0 seconds to 59 seconds, and then from 1 minute to 99 minutes. If this property value is true for longer than 0.5 seconds, the fade time will auto-increment until the property value changes to false or until the maximum fade time (99 minutes) is reached.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.ClsC6xBase.ClsC6SceneProgramming.DecrementFadeTime
member.summary: Property to decrement the fade time. The fade time is the time it takes for all the lights in the scene to reach their target levels. The fade time will decrement within a range of 99 minutes to 1 minute, and then 59 seconds to 0 seconds. If this property value is true for longer than 0.5 seconds, the fade time will auto-decrement until this property value changes to false or until the fade time reaches 0 seconds.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.ClsC6xBase.ClsC6SceneProgramming.FadeTimeInMinutesFeedback
member.summary:
Property to indicate that the fade time is in minutes when the property value is true, and seconds when the value is false.
This property will trigger event with .

member.summary:
Property to report the fade time in minutes or seconds.
This property will trigger event with .

Occupancy Sensing class for .

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.ClsC6xBase.ClsC6OccupancySensing.EnableEntryScene
member.summary: Method to enable the entry scene. When enabled, the entry scene is executed when the value changes to true as the result of motion activity (but not function activity).

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.ClsC6xBase.ClsC6OccupancySensing.DisableEntryScene
member.summary: Method to disable the entry scene. When disabled, the entry scene will not be executed, regardless of the occupancy status of the room.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.ClsC6xBase.ClsC6OccupancySensing.EnableExitScene
member.summary: Method to enable the exit scene. When enabled, the exit scene is executed when the property value changes to false.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.ClsC6xBase.ClsC6OccupancySensing.DisableExitScene
member.summary: Method to disable the exit scene. When disabled, the exit scene will not be executed, regardless of the occupancy status of the room.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.ClsC6xBase.ClsC6OccupancySensing.EnableActivityReporting
member.summary: Property to enable activity reporting via the and properties. If the system is combining rooms (via a object) and making use of occupancy sensing, then must be set to true for all units which may be combined. true = Enable activity reporting; false = Disable activity reporting

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.ClsC6xBase.ClsC6OccupancySensing.MotionActivityFeedback
member.summary:
Property to indicate that the CLS-C6 occupancy timer has been reset due to motion being detected in the room.
This property will trigger event with .
member.remarks: false to true = Motion activity detected

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.ClsC6xBase.ClsC6OccupancySensing.FunctionActivityFeedback
member.summary:
Property to indicate that the CLS-C6 occupancy timer has been reset due to a button being pressed on the CLS-C6 or attached keypad, or a command being received on the network.
This property will trigger event with .
member.remarks: false to true = Function activity detected

members.member:
Property to indicate that the room is occupied.
This property will trigger event with .
true = Room occupied; false = Room unoccupied

member.summary: Property to set timeout remotely. This property is not supported by .

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.ClsC6xBase.ClsC6OccupancySensing.CurrentTimeoutFeedback
member.summary: Property to indicate which timeout is being used by the sensor. This property is not supported by .

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.ClsC6xBase.ClsC6OccupancySensing.EntrySceneEnabledFeedback
member.summary:
Property to indicate that the entry scene is enabled.
This property will trigger event with .
member.remarks: true = Entry scene enabled; false = Entry scene not enabled

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.ClsC6xBase.ClsC6OccupancySensing.ExitSceneEnabledFeedback
member.summary:
Property to indicate that the exit scene is enabled.
This property will trigger event with .
member.remarks: true = Exit scene enabled; false = Exit scene not enabled

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.ClsC6xBase.ClsC6OccupancySensing.IncrementTimeoutHours
member.summary: Property to increment the timeout in hours. The hours increment within a range of 0 to 17 hours. This property is not used with CLS-C6 firmware version 2.0 and later since the maximum motion timeout is 30 minutes. The hours increment within a range of 0 to 17 hours. If this property value is true for longer than 0.5 seconds, the hours will auto-adjust until the property value changes to false or until 17 hours is reached.
member.remarks: false to true = Increment timeout hours; false = No effect or true = Auto-adjust; false = Stop

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.ClsC6xBase.ClsC6OccupancySensing.DecrementTimeoutHours
member.summary: Property to decrement the timeout in hours. The hours increment within a range of 0 to 17 hours. This property is not used with CLS-C6 firmware version 2.0 and later since the maximum motion timeout is 30 minutes.
member.remarks: false to true = Decrement timeout hours; false = No effect or true = Auto-adjust; false = Stop

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.ClsC6xBase.ClsC6OccupancySensing.IncrementTimeoutMinutes
member.summary: Property to increment the timeout period by one minute. If the property value is true for longer than 0.5 seconds, the timeout will auto-adjust until the property value changes to false or until the maximum minutes is reached.
member.remarks: false to true = Increment timeout; false = No effect or true = Auto-adjust; false= Stop

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.ClsC6xBase.ClsC6OccupancySensing.DecrementTimeoutMinutes
member.summary: Property to decrement the timeout period by one minute. If the property value is true for longer than 0.5 seconds, the timeout will auto-adjust until the property value changes to false or until 0 minutes is reached.
member.remarks: false to true = Decrement timeout; false = No effect or true = Auto-adjust; false = Stop

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.ClsC6xBase.ClsC6OccupancySensing.TimeoutHoursFeedback
member.summary:
This property is not used with CLS-C6 firmware version 2.0 and later. For firmware versions earlier than 2.0, this property reports the hours portion of the timeout period.
This property will trigger event with .

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.ClsC6xBase.ClsC6OccupancySensing.TimeoutMinutesFeedback
member.summary:
Property to report the minutes portion of the timeout period.
This property will trigger event with .

member.name: T:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.ClwDimExDimmerRemoteButtonSettings
member.summary: Class to specify the parameters of the keypad button functions when the unit is in Remote Mode.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.ClwDimExDimmerRemoteButtonSettings.ParameterReservedButtonForLocalMode
member.summary: Specifies which button is reserved to operate in Local mode when the unit is set to Remote mode. Zero = None and One through the number of supported buttons specifies the buttons.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.ClwDimExDimmerRemoteButtonSettings.ParameterRemoteHoldTime
member.summary: The time that a button must be held before it is recognized as a "Hold" instead of a "Tap". Valid values range from 0.20 to 1.00 seconds. Use the SimplSharpDeviceHelper.SecondsToUShort to convert the time to a ushort value or the SimplSharpDeviceHelper.UShortToSeconds to convert the ushort value to seconds

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.ClwDimExDimmerRemoteButtonSettings.ParameterRemoteDoubleTapTime
member.summary: The time between the end of the first tap and the start of the second tap for a double tap to be recognized. Valid values range from 0.20 to 1.00 seconds. Use the SimplSharpDeviceHelper.SecondsToUShort to convert the time to a ushort value or the SimplSharpDeviceHelper.UShortToSeconds to convert the ushort value to seconds

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.ClwDimExDimmerRemoteButtonSettings.ParameterRemoteWaitForDoubleTap
member.summary: Determines whether a "Tap" should be sent immediately on the release of the button, or if the unit should wait until a Double Tap event occurs

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.ClwDimExDimmerRemoteButtonSettings.ParameterBargraphBehavior
member.summary: Specifies the bargraph functionality of the LED indicators in Remote mode. (In Local mode the LED bargraph is always on, and always reflects the current load level).

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.ClwDimExDimmerRemoteButtonSettings.ParameterBargraphTimeout
member.summary: When the BargraphBehavior parameter is set to Change Only or Remote, this parameter specifies the time that must elapse with no change to the integer value before the LEDs revert to standard behavior. Use the SimplSharpDeviceHelper.SecondsToUShort to convert the time to a ushort value or the SimplSharpDeviceHelper.UShortToSeconds to convert the ushort value to seconds

member.name: T:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.ClwDimExDimmerRemoteButtonSettings.eBargraphBehavior
member.summary: Enumeration that defines the valid values for the BargraphBehavior Parameter.

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.ClwDimExDimmerRemoteButtonSettings.eBargraphBehavior.AlwaysOn
member.summary: LEDs will always operate as a bargraph that displays the current load level.

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.ClwDimExDimmerRemoteButtonSettings.eBargraphBehavior.ChangeOnly
member.summary: The LEDs will convert to a bargraph only when the load level changes. The LEDs will display the load level while it's changing. Once the level has been stable for the time given by RemoteBargraphTimeout Parameter, the LEDs will revert to standard behavior.

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.ClwDimExDimmerRemoteButtonSettings.eBargraphBehavior.Remote
member.summary: The LEDs will display the value of the RemoteBargraph property on the Remote Buttons slot.

member.name: T:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.ClwDimExDimmerUISettings
member.summary: Class to specify the parameters of the user interface of this unit.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.ClwDimExDimmerUISettings.SetPresetDefaultLevel(System.Int32,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Sets the default level of the corresponding preset. This level will be active at startup and whenever the reset function is triggered. If the preset has already been reprogrammed, then the programmed value is retained until the value is reset. Select 0% to use the factory-default level. Select a non-zero value to specify a new default preset level. Default Values are Zero for all of the presets; Use to convert the percentage to a ushort value or to convert the ushort value to percentage.
member.param: Number of the present to set, one based.
the default level of the corresponding preset. This level will be active at startup and whenever the reset function is triggered. Valid values from 0 -> 100.
member.exception: Invalid parameter or parameter value specified.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.ClwDimExDimmerUISettings.GetPresetDefaultLevel(System.Int32)
member.summary: Read the default level of the corresponding preset. Use to convert the percentage to a ushort value or to convert the ushort value to percentage
member.param: Preset to query for it's current default setting.
member.returns: The current value of the preset
member.exception: Invalid parameter specified

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.ClwDimExDimmerUISettings.ParameterButtonLogic
member.summary: Sets the mode for button functionality to local or remote.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.ClwDimExDimmerUISettings.ParameterLEDOnLevel
member.summary: Sets the LED feedback level when the LED is on. Valid values range from 50% to 100%. Use to convert the percentage to a ushort value or to convert the ushort value to percentage

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.ClwDimExDimmerUISettings.ParameterNightLightLevel
member.summary: Sets the level of the LEDs when in night light mode. When set to 0% the night light feature is disabled. When set to a value between 0% to 20% then all LEDs will glow at a low-intensity level when all LEDs are programmed to be off. Use to convert the percentage to a ushort value or to convert the ushort value to percentage

member.name: T:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.eCLWButtonLayout
member.summary: Enumeration to describe the different valid button layout possible for this device.

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.eCLWButtonLayout.LayoutOne
member.summary: 1-button layout (1 rocker button).

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.eCLWButtonLayout.LayoutTwo
member.summary: 2-button layout (2 half buttons).

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.eCLWButtonLayout.LayoutThree
member.summary: 4-button layout (4 quarter buttons).

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.eCLWButtonLayout.LayoutFour
member.summary: 3-button layout (1 half button on top, 2 quarter buttons on the bottom).

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.eCLWButtonLayout.LayoutFive
member.summary: 3-button layout (1 quarter button on top, 1 half button in the center, 1 quarter button on the bottom).

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.eCLWButtonLayout.LayoutSix
member.summary: 3-button layout (2 quarter buttons on top, 1 half button on the bottom).

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.ClwDimswex.ParameterRaiseLowerRate
member.summary: Sets the time that it takes to ramp the light level from 0% to 100% (or vice versa) in raise/lower operations. Field is in hundredths of a second. Default value is 3 seconds (300 hundredths of a second). Valid values range from 1 second to 5 seconds. Use the SimplSharpDeviceHelper.SecondsToUShort to convert the time to a ushort value or the SimplSharpDeviceHelper.UShortToSeconds to convert the ushort value to seconds

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.ClwDimswex.ParameterPresetFadeTime
member.summary: Sets the time that it takes to ramp the light level from its current level to the target level in preset recalls or full on operations. Field is in hundredths of a second. Default value is 1 second (100 hundredths of a second). Valid values range from 0.25s to 10s. Use the SimplSharpDeviceHelper.SecondsToUShort to convert the time to a ushort value or the SimplSharpDeviceHelper.UShortToSeconds to convert the ushort value to seconds

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.ClwDimswex.ParameterOffFadeTime
member.summary: Sets the time that it takes to ramp the light level from its current level to 0% in full off and delayed off operations. Field is in hundredths of a second. Default value is 1 second (100 hundredths of a second). Valid values range from 0.25s to 30s. Use the SimplSharpDeviceHelper.SecondsToUShort to convert the time to a ushort value or the SimplSharpDeviceHelper.UShortToSeconds to convert the ushort value to seconds

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.ClwDimswex.ParameterDimmerDelayedOffTime
member.summary: Sets the delay time prior to starting the off fade when performing a Dimmer delayed off operation. Field is in hundredths of a second. Default value is 0 seconds. Valid delay times range from 0s (no delay) to 10m (minutes). Use the SimplSharpDeviceHelper.SecondsToUShort to convert the time to a ushort value or the SimplSharpDeviceHelper.UShortToSeconds to convert the ushort value to seconds

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.ClwDimex.ParameterRaiseLowerRate
member.summary: Sets the time that it takes to ramp the light level from 0% to 100% (or vice versa) in raise/lower operations. Field is in hundredths of a second. Default value is 3 seconds (300 hundredths of a second). Valid values range from 1 second to 5 seconds. Use the SimplSharpDeviceHelper.SecondsToUShort to convert the time to a ushort value or the SimplSharpDeviceHelper.UShortToSeconds to convert the ushort value to seconds

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.ClwDimex.ParameterPresetFadeTime
member.summary: Sets the time that it takes to ramp the light level from its current level to the target level in preset recalls or full on operations. Field is in hundredths of a second. Default value is 1 second (100 hundredths of a second). Valid values range from 0.25s to 10s. Use the SimplSharpDeviceHelper.SecondsToUShort to convert the time to a ushort value or the SimplSharpDeviceHelper.UShortToSeconds to convert the ushort value to seconds

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.ClwDimex.ParameterOffFadeTime
member.summary: Sets the time that it takes to ramp the light level from its current level to 0% in full off and delayed off operations. Field is in hundredths of a second. Default value is 1 second (100 hundredths of a second). Valid values range from 0.25s to 30s. Use the SimplSharpDeviceHelper.SecondsToUShort to convert the time to a ushort value or the SimplSharpDeviceHelper.UShortToSeconds to convert the ushort value to seconds

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.ClwDimex.ParameterDimmerDelayedOffTime
member.summary: Sets the delay time prior to starting the off fade when performing a Dimmer delayed off operation. Field is in hundredths of a second. Default value is 0 seconds. Valid delay times range from 0s (no delay) to 10m (minutes). Use the SimplSharpDeviceHelper.SecondsToUShort to convert the time to a ushort value or the SimplSharpDeviceHelper.UShortToSeconds to convert the ushort value to seconds

member.name: T:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.Din.Din1Dim4
member.summary:
The Din1Dim4 provides four universal dimming channels for dimming loads such as incandescent, magnetic low voltage, and leading-edge dimmable ELV loads. The Din1Dim4 can be used in applications where reverse-phase dimming is not a requirement.
This class will trigger and events.
The Index field in the will indicate the that has changed.

member.name: T:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.ClwSwExSwitchUISettings
member.summary: Class to specify the parameters of the user interface of this unit.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.ClwSwExSwitchUISettings.ParameterButtonLogic
member.summary: Sets the mode for button functionality to local or remote.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.ClwSwExSwitchUISettings.ParameterLEDOnLevel
member.summary: Sets the LED feedback level when the LED is on. Valid values range from 50% to 100%. Use to convert the percentage to a ushort value or to convert the ushort value to percentage.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.ClwSwExSwitchUISettings.ParameterNightLightLevel
member.summary: Sets the level of the LEDs when in night light mode. When set to 0% the night light feature is disabled. When set to a value between 0%-20%, then all LEDs will glow at a low-intensity level when all LEDs are programmed to be off. Use to convert the percentage to a ushort value or to convert the ushort value to percentage.

member.name: T:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.ClwSwExSwitchRemoteButtonSettings
member.summary: Class to specify the parameters of the keypad button functions when the unit is in Remote Mode.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.ClwSwExSwitchRemoteButtonSettings.ParameterReservedButtonForLocalMode
member.summary: Specifies which button is reserved to operate in Local mode when the unit is set to Remote mode. Zero = None and One through the number of supported buttons specifies the buttons.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.ClwSwExSwitchRemoteButtonSettings.ParameterRemoteHoldTime
member.summary: The time that a button must be held before it is recognized as a "Hold" instead of a "Tap". Valid values range from 0.20 to 1.00 seconds. Use the SimplSharpDeviceHelper.SecondsToUShort to convert the time to a ushort value or the SimplSharpDeviceHelper.UShortToSeconds to convert the ushort value to seconds

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.ClwSwExSwitchRemoteButtonSettings.ParameterRemoteDoubleTapTime
member.summary: The time between the end of the first tap and the start of the second tap for a double tap to be recognized. Valid values range from 0.20 to 1.00 seconds. Use the SimplSharpDeviceHelper.SecondsToUShort to convert the time to a ushort value or the SimplSharpDeviceHelper.UShortToSeconds to convert the ushort value to seconds

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.ClwSwExSwitchRemoteButtonSettings.ParameterRemoteWaitForDoubleTap
member.summary: Determines whether a "Tap" should be sent immediately on the release of the button, or if the unit should wait until a Double Tap event occurs
